A **spear** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") one-handed weapon that can be used in [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") or [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") as a [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile"), and is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron").

## Generation

Ordinary spears make up about 5% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), and in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")).

[Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") in the [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army") have a 1⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a spear.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Salamanders](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander") have a 6⁄7 chance of generating with a spear.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Ice devils](/wiki/Ice_devil "Ice devil") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a spear.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit c09ae332](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/c09ae332c8b8f17daf072e95b0e03d75512577f7), [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start with a spear weapon instead of a long sword: [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") Valkyries start with a +1 spear, while [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") Valkyries start the game with a +1 [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear").

## Spear skill

| Spear   |                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max     | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                                                               |
| Basic   | - [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                         |
| Skilled | * [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") |
| Expert  | - [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                                                                                                                   |

The following weapons use the spear skill:

- spear
- [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear")
- [elven spear](/wiki/Elven_spear "Elven spear")
- [orcish spear](/wiki/Orcish_spear "Orcish spear")
- [silver spear](/wiki/Silver_spear "Silver spear")
- [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin")

Spears of all kinds make up about 9.7% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as death drops, and in shops). Spears have an additional +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus against all monsters when thrown, and have a separate +2 to-hit bonus against [kebabable](/wiki/Kebabable "Kebabable") [monster classes](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

Spears can be [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot"), and [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") get a +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") bonus for throwing spears of any kind.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

There are no [artifact weapons](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that use the spear skill.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per commit c09ae33 above, Valkyries can reach Expert skill in spear.

## Strategy

In the absence of [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") skills, a small stack of spears is a powerful [ranged weapon](/wiki/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") for any Caveperson or [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest") lucky enough to find more than one: most characters will require an antique weapons outlet to amass multiple spears in any timely manner. They are also quite heavy, with four spears outweighing a single [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe").

## History

The spear first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.3.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.1 "NetHack 3.3.1"), including variants based on those versions, [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start the game with a +2 spear.

From Hack 1.0 to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including variants based on those versions, spears cannot be multishot, and the javelin has its own separate skill in its appearances. [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") merges the javelin skill into the spear skill and makes all spear weapons eligible for multishot.

## Origin

The spear is a weapon designed for thrusting. Chimpanzees use very rudimentary spears, so it is likely that humans have used spears for an extremely long time.

## Variants

In some variants, monsters that generate with spears of any type will generate with a stack of them. Other variants add artifact weapons that use the spear skill.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), non-[dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start the game with a +1 spear, while dwarven [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start the game with a +1 dwarvish spear.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) [Lycanthropic](/wiki/Lycanthrope_\(starting_race\) "Lycanthrope (starting race)") characters in any role that start with a silver spear (i.e. [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer")) will instead receive a regular spear.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

[Gnolls](/wiki/Gnoll_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Gnoll (SLASH'EM)") have a 1⁄3 a chance of being [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a spear.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) Yendorian army soldiers no longer generate with spears.

The [Holy Spear of Light](/wiki/Holy_Spear_of_Light "Holy Spear of Light") is an [intelligent artifact](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") that uses the spear skill.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), [Dragonbane](/index.php?title=Dragonbane_\(SporkHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragonbane (SporkHack) (page does not exist)") uses the spear skill, with its base item changed to a dwarvish spear.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Dragonbane uses the spear skill, with its base item changed to a dwarvish spear as in SporkHack.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds the [atgeir](/wiki/Atgeir "Atgeir") and [droven spear](/wiki/Droven_spear "Droven spear") as weapons that use the spear skill.

[The Water Crystal](/wiki/Crystals_\(dNetHack\) "Crystals (dNetHack)") increases a character's skill cap in spears by 1 while carried.

The [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Huginn and Muninn](/index.php?title=Huginn_and_Muninn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Huginn and Muninn (page does not exist)") grants skill in spears while bound.

Many artifacts use the spear skill in some manner:

- [The Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/The_Rod_of_Lordly_Might "The Rod of Lordly Might"), [The Rod of the Elvish Lords](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Rod_of_the_Elvish_Lords "DNetHack artifacts") and [The Sceptre of Lolth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Sceptre_of_Lolth "DNetHack artifacts") are artifacts that can take on the form of a spear, elven spear or droven spear, respectively.
- [The Lance of Longinus](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Lance_of_Longinus "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful artifact silver spear.
- [The Spear of Peace](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Spear_of_Peace "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral, intelligent and [Madmen](/wiki/Madmen "Madmen")-favoring [wooden](/wiki/Wood "Wood") spear.
- [Gungnir](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Gungnir "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful, intelligent and Valkyrie-favoring artifact whose default [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is an atgeir. It can be created by successfully praying as a [piously aligned](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") lawful or neutral Valkyrie while wielding a non-artifact weapon that uses the spear skill and is enchanted to +5 or better - creating Gungnir this way will retain the form of the spear weapon used as the base item.
- [The Death-Spear of Vhaerun](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Death-Spear_of_Vhaerun "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral, intelligent and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble")-favoring silvered [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian") droven spear.
- [Yorshka's Spear](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Yorshka.27s_Spear "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful Noble-favoring spear.
- [The Rod of Seven Parts](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Rod_of_Seven_Parts "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful intelligent [platinum](/wiki/Platinum "Platinum") spear.

[Fishing village map inclusions](/wiki/Map_inclusion_\(dNetHack\)#Fishing_village "Map inclusion (dNetHack)") in the [Outlands rings](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Outlands#Outlands_rings "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands") have a 1⁄9 chance of generating a spear on each square.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [merfolk](/wiki/Merfolk_\(starting_race\) "Merfolk (starting race)") characters in any role that would start with a spear start with a [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident") instead.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") start with a +1 spear instead of a [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), and have the ability to knap soft [stones](/wiki/Stone "Stone") into [spearheads](/index.php?title=Spearhead\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spearhead (page does not exist)") by applying [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") - [The Sceptre of Might](/wiki/The_Sceptre_of_Might "The Sceptre of Might"), their [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), is also changed to a [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") spear.

[Salamander](/index.php?title=Salamander_\(starting_race\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Salamander (starting race) (page does not exist)") characters can always reach Expert in spears.

The spirit [Shiro](/wiki/Shiro "Shiro") generates with an uncursed [mineral](/wiki/Mineral "Mineral") spear when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds the [atlatl](/index.php?title=Atlatl_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Atlatl (EvilHack) (page does not exist)") and [dark elven spear](/wiki/Dark_elven_spear "Dark elven spear") as weapons that use the spear skill. Wizards are restricted in the spear skill, while [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") are unrestricted and can train to Expert in spears.

Monsters that randomly generate with spears of any type will generate with a stack of them. Watchmen and soldiers that do not receive [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of spears. [Sea tortles](/index.php?title=Sea_tortle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sea tortle (page does not exist)") have a 4⁄5 chance of generating with a stack of spears.

A spear can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining 2 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow") and a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"). Spears can be used to create many other items:

- A spear can be combined with 2 arrows to create a dwarvish spear.
- A spear can be combined with 2 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") to create a javelin.
- A spear can be combined with a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") to create a trident.
- A spear can be combined with a dagger to create an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe").
- A spear can be combined with a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword") to create a [partisan](/wiki/Partisan "Partisan").
- A spear can be combined with a [stiletto](/wiki/Stiletto "Stiletto") to create a [ranseur](/wiki/Ranseur "Ranseur").
- A spear can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create a [spetum](/wiki/Spetum "Spetum").
- A spear can be combined with a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") to create a [glaive](/wiki/Glaive "Glaive").
- A spear can be combined with a [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe") to create a [bardiche](/wiki/Bardiche "Bardiche").
- A spear can be combined with an axe to create a [voulge](/wiki/Voulge "Voulge").
- A spear can be combined with a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") to create a [fauchard](/wiki/Fauchard "Fauchard").
- A spear can be combined with a [grappling hook](/wiki/Grappling_hook "Grappling hook") to create a [guisarme](/wiki/Guisarme "Guisarme").
- A spear can be combined with a guisarme to create a bill-guisarme.
- A spear can be combined with a [war hammer](/wiki/War_hammer "War hammer") to create a [bec de corbin](/wiki/Bec_de_corbin "Bec de corbin").
- A spear can be combined with a [heavy war hammer](/wiki/Heavy_war_hammer "Heavy war hammer") to create a [lucern hammer](/wiki/Lucern_hammer "Lucern hammer").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [kobold](/wiki/Kobold_\(starting_race\) "Kobold (starting race)") characters can always reach at least Basic in spears.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds the atgeir from dNetHack as a weapon that uses the spear skill, and adds Elfrist and the Holy Spear of Light (known simply as the [Spear of Light](/wiki/Spear_of_Light "Spear of Light")) from SLASH'EM and [Gungnir](/index.php?title=Gungnir\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gungnir (page does not exist)") from dNetHack as artifact weapons that use the spear skill with the same base items.

Successfully [untrapping](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") a [spear trap](/index.php?title=Spear_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spear trap (page does not exist)") has a chance of generating an intact spear.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, a spear can be combined with a [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail") at a forge to create an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys").

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a spear will produce an elven spear, and upgrading an orcish spear will produce a regular spear.

## Encyclopedia entry

\- they come together with great random, and a spear is brast,  
and one party brake his shield and the other one goes down,  
horse and man, over his horse-tail and brake his neck, and  
then the next candidate comes randoming in, and brast his  
spear, and the other man brast his shield, and down he goes,  
horse and man, over his horse-tail, and brake his neck, and  
then there's another elected, and another and another and  
still another, till the material is all used up; and when you  
come to figure up results, you can't tell one fight from  
another, nor who whipped; and as a picture of living, raging,  
roaring battle, sho! why it's pale and noiseless - just  
ghosts scuffling in a fog. Dear me, what would this barren  
vocabulary get out of the mightiest spectacle? - the burning  
of Rome in Nero's time, for instance? Why, it would merely  
say 'Town burned down; no insurance; boy brast a window,  
fireman brake his neck!' Why, that ain't a picture!

\[ A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court, by Mark  
  Twain ]

A spear is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a stackable one-handed weapon that can be used in melee or thrown as a projectile, and is made of iron.

  • The Spear of Peace is a neutral, intelligent and Madmen-favoring wooden spear.
  • Gungnir is a lawful, intelligent and Valkyrie-favoring artifact whose default base item is an atgeir. It can be created by successfully praying as a piously aligned lawful or neutral Valkyrie while wielding a non-artifact weapon that uses the spear skill and is enchanted to +5 or better - creating Gungnir this way will retain the form of the spear weapon used as the base item.
  • The Death-Spear of Vhaerun is a neutral, intelligent and drow Noble-favoring silvered obsidian droven spear.
  • Yorshka's Spear is a lawful Noble-favoring spear.
  • The Rod of Seven Parts is a lawful intelligent platinum spear.

Fishing village map inclusions in the Outlands rings have a 1⁄9 chance of generating a spear on each square.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, merfolk characters in any role that would start with a spear start with a trident instead.

notdNetHack

In notdNetHack, in addition to dNetHack details, Cavepeople start with a +1 spear instead of a club, and have the ability to knap soft stones into spearheads by applying rocks - The Sceptre of Might, their quest artifact, is also changed to a bone spear.

Salamander characters can always reach Expert in spears.

The spirit Shiro generates with an uncursed mineral spear when summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder.

EvilHack

EvilHack adds the atlatl and dark elven spear as weapons that use the spear skill. Wizards are restricted in the spear skill, while Archeologists are unrestricted and can train to Expert in spears.

Monsters that randomly generate with spears of any type will generate with a stack of them. Watchmen and soldiers that do not receive racial equipment have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of spears. Sea tortles have a 4⁄5 chance of generating with a stack of spears.

A spear can be created at a forge by combining 2 arrows and a dagger. Spears can be used to create many other items:

  • A spear can be combined with 2 arrows to create a dwarvish spear.
  • A spear can be combined with 2 crossbow bolts to create a javelin.
  • A spear can be combined with a scimitar to create a trident.
  • A spear can be combined with a dagger to create an axe.
  • A spear can be combined with a broadsword to create a partisan.
  • A spear can be combined with a stiletto to create a ranseur.
  • A spear can be combined with a knife to create a spetum.
  • A spear can be combined with a short sword to create a glaive.
  • A spear can be combined with a battle-axe to create a bardiche.
  • A spear can be combined with an axe to create a voulge.
  • A spear can be combined with a saber to create a fauchard.
  • A spear can be combined with a grappling hook to create a guisarme.
  • A spear can be combined with a guisarme to create a bill-guisarme.
  • A spear can be combined with a war hammer to create a bec de corbin.
  • A spear can be combined with a heavy war hammer to create a lucern hammer.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, kobold characters can always reach at least Basic in spears.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds the atgeir from dNetHack as a weapon that uses the spear skill, and adds Elfrist and the Holy Spear of Light (known simply as the Spear of Light) from SLASH'EM and Gungnir from dNetHack as artifact weapons that use the spear skill with the same base items.

Successfully untrapping a spear trap has a chance of generating an intact spear.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, a spear can be combined with a flail at a forge to create an aklys.

Upgrading a spear will produce an elven spear, and upgrading an orcish spear will produce a regular spear.

A '''spear''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[stackable]] one-handed weapon that can be used in [[melee]] or [[thrown]] as a [[projectile]], and is made of [[iron]].

==Generation==
Ordinary spears make up about 5% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as [[death drop]]s, and in [[shop]]s).

[[Watchmen]] and [[soldier]]s in the [[Yendorian army]] have a {{frac|3}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a spear.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|179|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Salamander]]s have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of generating with a spear.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|485|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Ice devil]]s have a {{frac|4}} chance of generating with a spear.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|770|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|c09ae332c8b8f17daf072e95b0e03d75512577f7}}, [[Valkyrie]]s start with a spear weapon instead of a long sword: [[Human (starting race)|human]] Valkyries start with a +1 spear, while [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarven]] Valkyries start the game with a +1 [[dwarvish spear]].}}

==Spear skill==
{{spear skill table}}
The following weapons use the spear skill:

* spear
* [[dwarvish spear]]
* [[elven spear]]
* [[orcish spear]]
* [[silver spear]]
* [[javelin]]

Spears of all kinds make up about 9.7% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as death drops, and in shops). Spears have an additional +2 [[to-hit]] bonus against all monsters when thrown, and have a separate +2 to-hit bonus against [[kebabable]] [[monster class]]es.

Spears can be [[multishot]], and [[Cavepeople]] get a +1 [[multishot]] bonus for throwing spears of any kind.{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|138|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Caveman multishot}}{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|1065|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

There are no [[artifact weapon]]s that use the spear skill.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per commit c09ae33 above, Valkyries can reach Expert skill in spear.}}

==Strategy==
In the absence of [[dagger]] skills, a small stack of spears is a powerful [[ranged weapon]] for any Caveperson or [[Priest]] lucky enough to find more than one: most characters will require an antique weapons outlet to amass multiple spears in any timely manner. They are also quite heavy, with four spears outweighing a single [[pick-axe]].

==History==
The spear first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.3.1]], including variants based on those versions, [[Knight]]s start the game with a +2 spear.

From Hack 1.0 to [[NetHack 3.4.3]], including variants based on those versions, spears cannot be multishot, and the javelin has its own separate skill in its appearances. [[NetHack 3.6.0]] merges the javelin skill into the spear skill and makes all spear weapons eligible for multishot.

==Origin==
The spear is a weapon designed for thrusting. Chimpanzees use very rudimentary spears, so it is likely that humans have used spears for an extremely long time.

==Variants==
In some variants, monsters that generate with spears of any type will generate with a stack of them. Other variants add artifact weapons that use the spear skill.

===SLASH'EM===

[[Gnoll (SLASH'EM)|Gnolls]] have a {{frac|3}} a chance of being [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] a spear.{{refsrc|makemon.c|684|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} Yendorian army soldiers no longer generate with spears.

The [[Holy Spear of Light]] is an [[intelligent artifact]] that uses the spear skill.

In [[SporkHack]], [[Dragonbane (SporkHack)|Dragonbane]] uses the spear skill, with its base item changed to a dwarvish spear.
